title: Some on-air claims about Dominion Voting Systems were false, Fox News acknowledges in statement after deal is announced
summary:
(CNN)Dominion Voting Systems had two goals in its defamation case against Fox News ‚Äî accountability and ‚Äútrying to make Dominion whole,‚Äù said Justin Nelson, the lead counsel election technology company.
‚ÄúThis is really the first time that anyone has paid a price for telling the lies of the 2020 election and we‚Äôre very proud about that,‚Äù he said.
While the settlement does not stipulate that Fox‚Äôs anchors must acknowledge the lies on air, Nelson said it was a consequential outcome for the network.
The texts and emails that emerged during the litigation process from inside the Fox network were valuable, he said.
He said the settlement with Fox sends a ‚Äústrong message‚Äù to other right-wing outlets in which Dominion has ongoing legal disputes.

title: Judge in Fox News-Dominion defamation trial: 'The parties have resolved their case'
summary:
Fox News‚Äô $787.5 million settlement with Dominion Voting Systems is the largest publicly known defamation settlement in US history involving a media company.
Attorneys representing Dominion Voting Systems, leave the New Castle County Courthouse in Wilmington, Del., after the defamation lawsuit by Dominion Voting Systems against Fox News was settled just as the jury trial was set to begin, Tuesday, April 18, 2023.
But Fox won‚Äôt have to admit on-air that it spread lies about Dominion, a Dominion representative told CNN.
Fox lawyers leave the courthouse after Dominion Voting Systems and Fox settled a defamation lawsuit for $787.5 million, avoiding trial, over Fox's coverage of debunked election-rigging claims, in Delaware Superior Court, in Wilmington, Delaware, U.S. April 18, 2023.
By settling now, Fox deprived Dominion a chance to further expose its dishonesty with a weeks-long trial.

title: A surprising trick to making hard choices: Try thinking less
summary:
A surprising trick to making hard choices: Try thinking lessgirafchik123/Getty ImagesLife is filled with big decisions.
That's partly due to a fear of regret, Wulfhart says.
Then when you're making a decision, go down the list and see which one of your options checks more boxes on that list of values.
Can you speak to the role of regret when it comes to making decisions?
Many more people regret taking too long to make a decision than making a decision too quickly.

title: Run For Their Lives, the group targeted in the Colorado attack, is figuring out how to continue its mission
summary:
Run For Their Lives, the group targeted in the Colorado attack, is figuring out how to continue its missiontoggle caption David Zalubowski/APThe violent attack in Boulder over the weekend targeted a group that aims to bring public attention to the hostages Hamas continues to hold in Gaza.
Now, the organization is figuring out how to continue its mission in the aftermath of the violence.
Despite Sunday's attack, Klein says the group will continue to hold public events.
About 20 percent of the group's participants are non-Jews, but many view Sunday's attack as rooted in anti-Jewish hatred.
Khaykin says law enforcement and education are the best ways to curtail such violence and make clear anti-Jewish hatred is unacceptable.

title: Can bringing back manufacturing help the heartland catch up with 'superstar' cities?
summary:
Can bringing back manufacturing help the heartland catch up with 'superstar' cities?
Part 1 asked why Americans aren't filling the manufacturing jobs that are already here.
Last week, we looked at economics research that shows that manufacturing jobs continue to pay a higher premium than jobs in many other industries.
Part of the reason why the loss of manufacturing plants stung so hard wasn't just the manufacturing jobs themselves.
The manufacturing multiplier of 1.6 is much lower than the multiplier Moretti calculates for tech jobs: 5.

title: The true cost of prisons and jails is higher than many realize, researchers say
summary:
The true cost of prisons and jails is higher than many realize, researchers sayLiderina/Getty ImagesDorothy Gaines knows firsthand the burdens prison can put on a family.
So it was a lot of stress on her, as well as a lot of stress with me worried about them."
And even afterward, the person incarcerated and their family members often keep making less money, the report found.
The findings reached by other organizations on how much prison and jail actually costs people also vary widely.
In 2017, for instance, the Prison Policy Initiative estimated the country's prison and jail systems cost taxpayers and the families of incarcerated people around $180 billion per year.

title: Mother of slain Irish soldier Sean Rooney permitted to sue United Nations
summary:
The mother of a young Irish soldier killed in action in Lebanon three years ago has been given permission by the High Court to sue the United Nations in the Irish courts.
She is suing for mental distress allegedly sustained by her and other members of the soldier‚Äôs family as a result of the death of Pte Rooney.
The vehicle driven by Pte Rooney became separated from the other one and ended up in a town called Al-Aqbiyah where it came under gunfire and Pte Rooney was killed.
Mr Mackin said the United Nations is a proper party to the proceedings as it was involved in the operation of UNIFIL and Pte Rooney was killed in action on a UNIFIL peacekeeping mission.
Mr Justice Paul Coffey accepted jurisdiction and granted permission to issue a plenary summons against the United Nations and serve it on the UN based in New York.

title: Irish teens drinking and smoking less ‚Äî but mental health concerns continue to rise
summary:
Teenagers in Ireland are smoking and drinking less than their peers did in 1998, but are struggling more with their mental health, according to an in-depth new report.
They answered questions about their mental health, diet, smoking and drinking habits, sexual behaviour, and relationships with parents.
In 2022, fewer children reported spending evenings out with friends‚Äîjust 28%, compared to 38% in 1998.
The number of children drinking soft drinks daily dropped sharply from 37.4% in 2002 to just 6.6% in 2022.
There was also a small decrease in the proportion of 15‚Äì17 year olds who reported having had sexual intercourse.

title: What are the signs of loneliness in children and what should you do if your child is lonely?
summary:
Loneliness, says Breathnach, is when we perceive a gap between our desire for social connection and our experience of it.
‚ÄúA child might [even] have friendships, but there could be issues in the relationships, where the child feels excluded, alienated, isolated, sad, or bored.
‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean the child is lonely ‚Äî people have different social batteries.
Cassidy says a sudden difference in how your child is engaging with other children could indicate loneliness.
Children go from parents organising every social activity for them in primary school to parents organising nothing in secondary school.

title: Autopsy to be carried out later today on body of Carlow shopping centre gunman
summary:
The State pathologist is due to carry out an autopsy on the body of the man who fired shots in a Carlow shopping centre before fatally shooting himself.
On Sunday, he walked through the Fairgreen Shopping Centre in Carlow firing a shotgun in the air.
He then shot himself outside the shopping centre after being challenged by armed garda√≠.
The scene at Fairgreen Shopping Centre, Carlow on Sunday Photo: michaelorourkephotography.ieA girl sustained a minor leg injury when she fell while running from the centre.

title: Border Officials Told Not to Attend Events Tied to Diversity in Law Enforcement
summary:
The Trump administration this year ordered federal border agents and customs officers not to attend events hosted by organizations that support women or minority groups in law enforcement, according to a senior border official.
Customs and Border Protection, the largest law enforcement agency in the federal government, issued a little-noticed internal memo in late March telling its officials not to attend events or conferences hosted by organizations like Women in Federal Law Enforcement and the National Organization of Black Law Enforcement Executives, or NOBLE, said the senior official, Timothy Quinn.
Mr. Quinn worked at the agency for nearly 12 years until he retired on Friday as a result of the policy.
The memo, which invoked President Trump‚Äôs executive order banning diversity practices across the federal government, barred attendance at events or conferences ‚Äúthat have a gender basis, race basis or a culture basis,‚Äù Mr. Quinn said.
‚ÄúI think that‚Äôs discrimination,‚Äù said Mr. Quinn, the former head of Customs and Border Protection‚Äôs Office of Intergovernmental Public Liaison.

title: At Least 27 Killed After Israeli Soldiers Open Fire Near Gaza Aid Site
summary:
Israeli soldiers opened fire Tuesday morning near crowds of Palestinians walking toward a new food distribution site in southern Gaza, the Israeli military said.
The Red Cross and Gaza health ministry said at least 27 people had been killed.
Israeli soldiers opened fire on Sunday near an approach to the same food distribution site, and Palestinian officials said they killed at least 23 people.
The shootings, which the military said occurred roughly about 500 yards from the food distribution site, were the latest chaos surrounding a contentious new Israeli-backed system for food distribution sites in Gaza, where American private contractors oversee the handout of cardboard boxes of aid.
The Israeli-American initiative has only announced four aid distribution points ‚Äî compared with 400 under the previous U.N.-coordinated aid distribution system.

title: As the Trump Administration Slashes Federal Spending, Scientists Consider Leaving the U.S.
summary:
Ardem Patapoutian‚Äôs story is not just the American dream, it is the dream of American science.
But with the Trump administration slashing spending on science, Dr. Patapoutian‚Äôs federal grant to develop new approaches to treating pain has been frozen.
Scientific leaders say that‚Äôs risking the way American science has been done for years, and the pre-eminence of the United States in their fields.
The number of postdocs and graduate students in the United States applying for jobs abroad has spiked.
A scientific institute in Portugal said job inquiries from junior faculty members in the United States are up tenfold over the last two months.

title: Michael Boren Built an Airstrip on Protected Land. Now He Might Lead the Forest Service.
summary:
Michael Boren, founder of a billion-dollar tech company, Idaho ranch owner and Trump donor, has clashed with the U.S. Forest Service for years.
He was accused of flying a helicopter dangerously close to a crew building a Forest Service trail, prompting officials to seek a restraining order.
And in the fall, the Forest Service sent a cease-and-desist letter accusing a company that Mr. Boren controlled of building an unauthorized cabin on National Forest land.
Now, Mr. Boren is Mr. Trump‚Äôs nominee to oversee the very agency he has tussled with repeatedly.
He would also oversee the Natural Resources Conservation Service, which helps farmers and ranchers conserve natural resources on their own land.

title: One company’s quest for the perfect charger
summary:
Sure, most things plug into most other things, but now you have to worry about power and data throughput, making sure that everything works properly with everything else.
That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve spent years longing for what we call the God Cable: the one with fast enough everything to be the perfect charger for devices from phones to power tools.
On this episode of The Vergecast, we start by talking about one company‚Äôs effort to build its own version of the perfect charger.
Finally, we answer a question on the Vergecast Hotline (call 866-VERGE11 or email vergecast@theverge.com!)

title: Epic is making it easier to create MetaHumans
summary:
Epic Games‚Äô hyperrealistic MetaHuman characters are seriously impressive, and now the company is making it easier for developers to incorporate them into their projects.
At its State of Unreal show on Tuesday, Epic announced that the MetaHuman Creator is now embedded within Unreal Engine as part of Unreal Engine 5.6.
The company is also bringing its face-authoring tools for MetaHumans‚Äô faces to bodies, meaning developers will be able to create faces and bodies with fine-tuned parameters for their games or applications.
Onstage, Epic showed how the MetaHuman tools could be used to animate a character in real time ‚Äî and using just a consumer webcam to capture the actor‚Äôs facial movements.
Epic also has new licensing options that allow MetaHumans to be used with other game development engines or creative software.

title: Mario Kart World‚Äôs designers had to rethink everything to make it open world
summary:
From the very beginning, the goal for Mario Kart World was ambitious.
Instead of a series of individual racetracks, all of Mario Kart World‚Äôs courses take place on the same landmass, connected by a series of routes.
In terms of world design, I would say this world was designed for Mario Kart World.
In that sense, Mario Kart World course design is quite a bit more work compared to previous games.‚ÄùWhat is on Toad‚Äôs head?
But Toad‚Äôs appearance in Mario Kart World, in which he‚Äôs wearing a racing helmet, raises a new question as to what the helmet actually is.

title: Amazon has leaked Philips‚Äô new ambient wall light
summary:
Amazon‚Äôs UK site has an early listing for what appears to be a successor to the Philips Hue Play Light Bar.
The new Philips Hue Play Smart Wall Washer also casts an ambient glow on walls that can be synced to music and videos, but illuminates a wider area with better color output than its predecessor, thanks to ‚Äúprecisely arranged LEDs.‚ÄùThe Hue Wall Washer appears to be a significant upgrade over the Light Bar, but it‚Äôs considerably more expensive, too.
The Light Bar is currently on sale for $69.99 (normally $89.99) or available in a two-pack for $159.99, while a single Wall Washer unit is ¬£199.99, or around $270, according to Hueblog.
The Philips Hue Play Smart Wall Washer uses colored LEDs angled upwards to increase the coverage of its illumination.
The Wall Washer is twice as bright as its predecessor but two lights can still be paired for even illumination on either side of a TV.

title: Epic showed off Unreal Engine 5 with an impressive Witcher 4 tech demo
summary:
An ongoing tradition at Epic‚Äôs big keynotes is a gorgeous tech demo that shows off what its game engine is capable of.
For this year‚Äôs State of Unreal, the company turned to The Witcher and Cyberpunk 2077 developer CD Projekt Red.
The demo was built using Unreal Engine 5.6, and shows new protagonist Ciri exploring some forested lands and a marketplace known as Valdrest.
Last year the developer officially revealed The Witcher 4 ‚Äî with Ciri replacing Geralt in the lead ‚Äî with a cinematic trailer.
The 5.6 version of Unreal Engine, meanwhile, is available to developers starting today.
